casebody.data:
GEORGE W ROGERS against TABER CHADWICE. May 1828. OEBTIORA»!. A rule to take affidavits, docs not expiro at the next term after it it; taken, but stands until the cause is argued. Wall,

offered to read affidavits taken under a rule entered in this cause at November term.

Ryall,

objected to tbe reading of the affidavits, and staled, that at the November term last, lie bad taken a rule for affidavits, and examined witnesses; but that tbe opposite party took no depositions at that time, but just previous to this (May) term, gave notice of taking affidavits, and did take tbe depositions now offered. He apprehended that the rule for affidavits, taken in November, expired at the February term, and that the opposite party could take no affidavits subsequent to that term.

Ch. Justice.

That is not the proper construction of the rule. The rule did not expire at the February term ; but it stands until the cause is argued, and either party may take affidavits mider It. Therefore the affidavits were properly taken.
